intro: Pycnostachys whytei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, which bloom throughout the year under proper care. Its leaves are velvety and dark green, often with a waxy texture. Pycnostachys whytei is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
